page.title: 02FARMS AND CROFTS
page.content: Most of our area is taken up by farms and crofts. I live on a farm called Ladystone Farm. It is quite large for this area and covers 747 acres. About a third of the farm is arable and the rest is used for the animals. We have about 713 sheep, 102 cows, and calves, nine ducks, nine hens, 30 pigs and 150 turkeys. There are 16 fields. We grow more barley than anything else, and also potatoes, turnips and kale. When the crops are ready to pick all my family help. When we have picked all of them we keep some things and the rest of the crops get sold. They sometimes go to the local shop.
